revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=ASUS |model=RT-AC66U |revision=A1 (1.30) |series=AC1750 |upc=886227214341 |asin=B008ABOJKS |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Askey |manuf_model=RT2320W |manuf_rev=-E61 |availability=common |price=200 |est_release_date=06/10/2012 |fcc_date=05/30/2012 |fcc_id=MSQ-RTAC66U |ic_id=3568A-RTAC66U |type=wireless router |pwr_v=19 |pwr_amp=1.58 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4706 |cpu1_cspeed=600 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D-SCB0 |fla2=2 |fla2_brand=Macronix |fla2_model=MX25L1606EM2I-12G |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4T1G164QF-BCF7 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag=yes |serial=yes,, 3.3V TTL |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4360 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL,RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53125 |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |flags=AiCloud support |tp_firmware=Asuswrt-Merlin, DD-WRT, FreshTomato, Tomato (Shibby) |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=ASUS, ASUS_5G |default_ssid_regex=^ASUS$,,, ^ASUS_5G$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=08:60:6E, 10:BF:48, 30:85:A9, 50:46:5D |oui_eth=08:60:6E, 10:BF:48, 30:85:A9, 50:46:5D }} {{TagLine|802.11ac Dual-Band Wireless-AC1750 Gigabit Router}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.asus.com/Networks/Wireless_Routers/RTAC66U/}} {{•}} [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC66W/ (RT-AC66W)] {{•}} [http://www.asus.com/us/Networking/RTAC66R/ (RT-AC66R)] :[http://event.asus.com/2012/nw/rt-ac66u/ Specifications] "RT-AC66U" and "REV 1.30" is silkscreened on the (blue) board in the FCC photos. This router is sold in various brick & mortar stores as the [[ASUS RT-AC66R|RT-AC66R]] and [[ASUS RT-AC66W|RT-AC66W]].. The FCC label states the default SSID is '''ASUS'''. {{See also|ASUS RT-AC66U B1|Askey}} FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/MSQ-RTACHC00 MSQ-RTACHC00] (08/02/2016) ([https://fccid.io/document.php?id=3083315 FCC Doc]) ==Links of Interest== ===News=== * [http://www.asus.com/News/rZcy4jXiQPQ5F8YL/ ''ASUS Reveals the Next Generation 802.11ac RT-AC66U Router'' on '''ASUS'''] * [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-news/32170-netgear-suing-asus-for-wireless-hanky-panky ''NETGEAR Suing ASUS For Wireless Hanky Panky'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] ===Reviews=== * [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31841-asus-rt-ac66u-80211ac-dual-band-wireless-ac1750-gigabit-router-reviewed ''Tim Higgins'' review on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :10:BF:48 OUI on the label in the internal photos * [http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/internet-bandwidth-networking-clinic-4/%5Bmaylyns-review%5D-asus-rt-ac66u-dark-knight-rises-3845510.html ''Maylyn'''s review on the '''hardwarezone.com.sg''' forums] :UPC: 886227214341, EAN: 47164342, :OUI: 10:BF:48, rev. A1, mfg. year 2012 * [http://tweakers.net/productreview/66279/asus-rt-ac66u.html Review on '''tweakers.net'''] :CPU: [[Broadcom]] [http://www.broadcom.com/products/Wireless-LAN/802.11-Wireless-LAN-Solutions/BCM4706 BCM4706KPBG] MIPS74K, @600MHz :Flash: [[Samsung]] K9F1G08U0D-SCB0 128MB, SLC :RAM: 2x [[Samsung]] K4T1G164QF-BCF7 256MB, DDR2 @800MHz :2.4GHz: [[Broadcom]] BCM4331KMLG + 3x PA (E0GB 2AKC 216A) :5GHz: [[Broadcom]] BCM4360KMLG + 3x PA (5003L1 210ED 1210) ::''SiGe'' SE5003L, 23dBm (200mW) [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/SE5003L_202392B.pdf Datasheet] :Switch: [[Broadcom]] BCM53125SKMML 1GbE ===Forum threads=== * [http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?30230-New-Asus-RT-AC66U-router-%285G-802-11ac%29 ''New ASUS RT-AC66U router (5G 802.11ac)'' on '''wl500g.info'''] * [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=159637 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] (w/ DD-WRT test build and internal images :posted by Magnetron1.1 [hosted on Mediafire], official support added :in build 20873 - 20130308 per [http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Supported_Devices#Asus the '''DD-WRT''' wiki]) :50:46:5D OUI on a label shot [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=159637&start=240 in the thread] :08:60:6E OUI on a DD-WRT build shot [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=159637&start=210 in the thread] :A later revision A2 model [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=159637&start=270 in the thread] has "RT-AC66U" and "REV 1.60" :silkscreened on the board. * [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=86437&start=855 Small info dump in the RT-N66U thread on the DD-WRT forums] :Serial log indicates the device has an additional 2MB Serial Flash chip ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing DD-WRT=== #Download firmware image [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/download.php?id=24818 here] #Set static ip of 192.168.1.7 #reset to defaults in Asus GUI or in recovery mode #In recovery mode, upload [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/download.php?id=24818 BrainSlayer's file] #Give the router plenty of time to flash and reboot. #Once able browse to 192.168.1.1, if you see the change password screen of dd-wrt then ::do a hard reset which puts the router in recovery mode, select erase nvram and reboot. ::If you donot see the change password screen start over from step 1. ===Flashing Tomato=== {{SCollapse|ASUS Tomato Flash Guide |{{Asus Tomato Flash Guide}} }} ==Upgrading== ===Updating DD-WRT=== {{SCollapse|ASUS DD-WRT Upgrade Guide |{{Upgrade dd-wrt|}} }} ==USB Info== {{USB dd-wrt|}} {{USB TomatoUSB|}} ==Pictures==
'''Asus' Images''' File:Asus_RT-AC66U_001.jpg|front File:Asus_RT-AC66U_002.jpg|angled File:Asus_RT-AC66U_003.jpg|angled2 File:Asus_RT-AC66U_004.jpg|back File:Asus_RT-AC66U_005.jpg|angled3 File:Asus_RT-AC66U_006.jpg|front2 File:Asus_RT-AC66U_007.jpg|top File:Asus_RT-AC66U_008.jpg|side File:Asus_RT-AC66U_009.jpg|side angled File:Asus_RT-AC66U_010.jpg|back File:Asus_RT-AC66U_011.jpg|Details

'''Magnetron1.1's Unit''' File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_TopViewPCB.JPG|Top view of System PCB File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_TVnoHS.JPG|Top view without heat sink File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_TVnoHSnoEMI.JPG|Top view without heat sink, EMI shields, and 3 heat conductive foam tape pads File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_CPU.JPG|Closeup of Broadcom CPU File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_SamsungDRAM.JPG|Closeup of Samsung SDRAM's File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_EtherSwitch.JPG|Closeup of Broadcom Ethernet Switch File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_802.11ICs.JPG|Closeup of Broadcom 802.11 IC's File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_BotViewPCB.JPG|Bottom view of System PCB File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_BVnoGndPlate.JPG|Bottom view without ground plate File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_MacronixFlashMem.JPG|Closeup of Macronix 2MB NOR Serial Flash Memory File:Magnetron1.1_RT-AC66U_SamsungFlashMem.JPG|Closeup of Samsung 128MB NAND Flash Memory
[[Has images::internal| ]] ==Notes== ===jffs Issue in DD-WRT=== This problem is caused by the firmware encountering an unmarked bad block during an erase operation while attempting to setup a JFFS2 filesystem on device /dev/mtd/4. Most people will probably never experience this problem. The AC66U, the [[Buffalo AirStation WZR-D1800H|D1800H]], and the Buffalo [[Buffalo AirStation WLI-H4-D1300|WLI-H4-D1300 Media Bridge]] use the same Samsung flash memory chip. In my case, 4 of my 5 D1800H's had the problem but my [[Buffalo AirStation WLI-H4-D1300|D1300]] didn't. Neither of my AC66U's had the problem. One person on one of the AC66U threads reported having the problem; here's a link to his post. If you have the problem, you will not be able to create or copy directories and files to /jffs. Here are some example error messages:(this list was shortened to save space - it can go on for several pages)
root@WZR-D1800HRT2:~# dmesg|grep jffs jffs2: jffs2_scan_eraseblock(): Magic bitmask 0x1985 not found at 0x05ee0020: 0xe952 instead jffs2: jffs2_scan_eraseblock(): Magic bitmask 0x1985 not found at 0x05ee0024: 0x0e6d instead jffs2: Further such events for this erase block will not be printed jffs2: Old JFFS2 bitmask found at 0x05efc7fc jffs2: You cannot use older JFFS2 filesystems with newer kernels jffs2: Cowardly refusing to erase blocks on filesystem with no valid JFFS2 nodes jffs2: empty_blocks 379, bad_blocks 1, c->nr_blocks 760
Also the Status -> Router webpage will show that JFFS2 has no free space. To fix this problem try the following at a command line prompt:
flash_erase -j /dev/mtd/4 0 0 && reboot
This command erases and marks bad any bad blocks encountered so that they can be "skipped" :and formats the partition to JFFS2 specifications. :I believe the firmware uses the mtd erase command which seems to fail at handling bad blocks. :The flash_erase command needs to be run only once. - Magnetron1.1 ===Trouble with recovery mode=== [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=757462#757462 mhchm] I just want to give a tip for anybody who has trouble getting into recovery mode. I didn't find this simple information on the internet yet. First, some context: I flashed a Brainslayer build from a Fractal build, and then my router stopped responding to ping. When booting normally, the power and ethernet LEDs would light up. The same thing happened when booting up with the reset button pressed, which should have put into recovery mode, but didn't. When booting up with the WPS button pressed, the power LED would flash and clear the NVRAM. The router then started up and enabled the two radios, broadcasting a "dd-wrt" SSID, but still no ping. To force it into recovery mode: Set a static IP of 192.168.1.2 Press the '''WPS''' button and start up Let the power LED flash rapidly for 5 seconds, then release WPS '''Immediately press the reset button, keeping it pressed until the power LED flashes slowly''' Release the reset button Point your browser to 192.168.1.1 Voilà. ===revinfo=== [https://code.google.com/p/wl500g/source/detail?r=4635 per comments on a commit on ''Oleg'''s '''wl500g''' Google Code repo] ====wl -i eth1 revinfo (BCM4331)==== 
admin@RT-AC66U:/tmp/home/root# wl -i eth1 revinfo
vendorid 0x14e4
deviceid 0x4332
radiorev 0x2059000
chipnum 0x4331
chiprev 0x2
chippackage 0x8
corerev 0x1d
boardid 0xf5b2
boardvendor 0x14e4
boardrev P100
driverrev 0x61e271f
ucoderev 0x2f10071
bus 0x1
phytype 0x7
phyrev 0x1
anarev 0x0
====wl -i eth2 revinfo (BCM4360)==== 
admin@RT-AC66U:/tmp/home/root# wl -i eth2 revinfo
vendorid 0x14e4
deviceid 0x43a2
radiorev 0x32069000
chipnum 0x4360
chiprev 0x2
chippackage 0x1
corerev 0x28
boardid 0x621
boardvendor 0x14e4
boardrev P305
driverrev 0x61e271f
ucoderev 0x2f10071
bus 0x1
phytype 0xb
phyrev 0x0
anarev 0x0
